Topic.Title: AMZN Board

Message.Msg: "This is one of the worst, douche infested board I have seen to date." All Yahoo message boards for stocks are the same. An individual makes a position, the price moves against him or her, then the person starts posting trying to justify their holding onto his/her losing position. Same pattern in all Yahoo message boards for stocks. On the other hand, I don't try to justify my losing positions. I jettison them (mentally or in real wold) and start another bet with a portion of my remaining capital. Do you try to justify your bet on the red whey the ball at a roulette table lands in the black slot? There is absolutely nothing good about arguing why the ball should have landed in the red slot.

Message.Title: Insider Selling in Market Has Reached Deeply Bearish Levels

Topic.Title: It looks like distribution

Message.Msg: Benny is scheduled to release his monthly FOMC notes tomorrow. My stance is market will retreat if there's no hint of additional QE or some hint to tapering of the current QE rate. QE is very much built into the price at this point. I could be wrong but the market won't go up much more unless Europe join the mix. There has to be a correction for the QE money to built up before the next move up. Otherwise it just running on fumes at this point and more prone to much bigger breaks.

Message.Title: Nice comparison by Forbes
Message.Msg: "If we assume that Amazon’s NOPAT margin averages 1.4%, close to its current level, then it would need to grow NOPAT by 25% compounded annually for nearly 25 years. At that point, revenues would be $3.8 trillion, nearly 10x that of Wal-Mart’s in fiscal year 2012. Nothing is impossible, but this scenario seems highly improbable." http://www.forbes.com/sites/greatspeculations/2013/05/21/amazons-thin-margins-do-not-support-sky-high-valuation/2/

Message.Title: Amazon's new Seattle Headquarters is going to cost some bucks!
Message.Msg: Hey Amazon fans and fools, keep running that AMZN price up. Jeffy needs your money to pay for the futuristic headquarters in Seattle that at this point looks like it will come in somewhere in the neighborhood of $1.8B. What the heck, Apple is building a futuristic headquarters in Sunnyvale and Jeffy is convinced that he is as everything that Steve Jobs was and Amazon needs a headquarters to match Apple. The problem is that Apple always made money. Jeffy has only made money on AMZN stock. Oh, and for you AMZN fans and fools that are waiting for the promised earnings to come to justify what you are paying for AMZN stock, Amazon is looking more like a high-end retail spender that it does like a lean-and-mean startup.
